equipment.name: Frying Pan
descriptions: Functions as both a bludgeoning weapon and a small shield. What's not to like?
It's not much less effective than a small mace, honestly.
It'll make a nice, satisfying CLANG that you just won't get from a flanged mace.
flavor: "I have seen greater men than you brought low by a woman with a frying pan." -- Solo

equipment.name: Masterwork Cutting Board
descriptions: Guaranteed not to scratch, or your money back.
It's just a block of wood, but then again, so is a shield.
These are designed to stop knives, so why not swords?
flavor: "It is a dark day that forces me to bear a humble cutting board for defence." -- Talrath

equipment.name: Chopsticks
descriptions: It's like a pair of wooden daggers. You could probably poke someone's eye out.
Technically, dual-wielding bonuses can apply to these.
Is that red stain blood, or just sweet and sour sauce...?
flavor: "They are better than nothing, and I mean that in the most unflattering way possible." -- Aria

equipment.name: Cheap Replica Sword
descriptions: This is it! The legendary sword! ...wait, what's this "Made in Chongsheng" sticker on the handle?
This is it! The legendary sword! ...No, this can't be it... Too bad.
Don't worry, we'll get you a real sword later.
flavor: "Think this is funny? Let's see how hard you laugh after I shove this down your throat." -- Hodge

equipment.name: A Stick
descriptions: It's a wand, if you pretend hard enough.
An enterprising merchant might pass this off as an all-natural, organic wand.
With the power of imagination, you can transform it into a wand!
flavor: "The sad thing is, this isn't the lowest-quality wand I've ever had to use." -- Marty

equipment.name: Fuzzy Robes
descriptions: Isn't this some great mage's bathrobe?
These fine robes offer protection from ambient humidity... okay, it's a bathrobe.
Fortunately, the mage whose bathrobe this is thought to enchant it a tiny bit, just in case.
flavor: "I suppose I shall now be prepared if we happen to bump into a steam golem." -- Avaris

equipment.name: The Big Book of Cantrips
descriptions: Its only practical use is to remind you that you have real spells you can use.
A collection of magical party tricks for aspiring casters or those with their sights set low.
Maybe one of these harmless spells will at least distract the monsters for a moment.
flavor: "I remember this book. I last read it when I was five." -- Laurie

equipment.name: Ring of Arcane Might
descriptions: Enhances the spells you cast as long as you only use the ring finger to do it.
This small and unimpressive ring grants a small and unimpressive boost to magic.
This ring sits on your finger and only amplifies the power of spells that pass through it.
flavor: "For a moment there, I was worried we'd found something useful." -- Dresbin

equipment.name: Macaroni Holy Symbol
descriptions: Some priest's kid probably made this.
The product of sunday school, no doubt.
Can macaroni even be holy?
flavor: "I was not aware my fellow men of the cloth were being equipped by children." -- Neville

equipment.name: Ceremonial Robes
descriptions: Completely unsuitable for use in a dungeon, but sometimes you have to take what you can get.
They provide absolutely no protection but at least they make you look clerical.
White silk with gold threading certainly looks fancy but doesn't stop monsters whacking you.
flavor: "These robes are dry clean only. Wearing them in this dungeon will ruin them." -- Siebel

equipment.name: Incorrect Holy Symbol
descriptions: It's a holy symbol for SOMEONE'S deity, and that's close enough for now.
This belongs to some religion so obscure even its followers don't remember it.
Maybe if you glue a couple more bits of wood to it, it'll look just like one of yours.
flavor: "I think the followers of Kra'fina were peaceful farmers. Or tyrants. History is fuzzy on the details." -- Mulcahy

equipment.name: Holy Page
descriptions: The rest of the Holy Book is missing, but the verse on this page is a poignant one.
Maybe the rest of book is around here somewhere.
It would be nicer to have the whole book, but Page 77 will have to do.
flavor: "It appears to cut off before the last word, but I'll take a guess that it's 'Amen'." -- Erdan

equipment.name: Empty Flour Sack
descriptions: A hood would be better, but anything that covers your face will suffice.
Hopefully you don't have a gluten allergy.
Try not to let the leftover particles of flour make you sneeze.
flavor: "Here, let's put 'dis over Tal'akh's face so we don't have to look at him." -- Wyatt

equipment.name: Carpet Squares
descriptions: Tie them to your boots to muffle your footsteps. In theory, anyway.
Wear them on your feet and it's almost as if the whole dungeon is carpeted.
If the dungeon has no carpet, then bring the carpet to it.
flavor: "This would be a better plan if the carpet wasn't lime green. Not much better. But better." -- Aria

equipment.name: Black Flag
descriptions: Wear it as a cloak. Perfect for anti-heroes; it's as dark as your past is.
This perfectly black flag is the banner of the Darkest Elven Queendoms.
The flag is from an underground nation with no light. But why would they need a flag at all?
flavor: "I would appreciate it if sssomone could cut a head hole into thisss thing..." -- Mardak

equipment.name: Padded Gloves
descriptions: For when you need to walk on your hands, of course.
Protects you from grazing your hands on the rough dungeon walls.
Guaranteed to prevent papercuts or your money back.
flavor: "Hang on, these are just oven mitts!" -- Talon

equipment.name: Double Clawed Hammer
descriptions: You can still drive nails with it if you turn it sideways, I guess.
Maybe you're meant to dual-wield it with a double-headed hammer?
Someone obviously doesn't understand the purpose of hammers.
flavor: "I'm not sure this is an upgrade from the chunk o' rock I was using before." -- Davey

equipment.name: Tri-Headed Screwdriver
descriptions: Only the elves use these kinds of screws, but it might be handy...?
These screws are used by craftsmen who want to prevent people from repairing their things.
Only the most determined collector would even bother owning one of these.
flavor: "Has anyone here ever seen a screw that this would be compatible with?" -- Volkur

equipment.name: Unserrated Pliers
descriptions: They could still turn bolts well enough in a pinch.
You'll need an iron grip for these to do anything useful.
These must have come from the most useless toolbox ever.
flavor: "I know it is said a poor workman blames his tools, but in this instance, I feel justified." -- Avaris

equipment.name: Circular Spirit Level
descriptions: Maybe it's more useful in another plane of existence.
Obviously this is used when performing n-dimensional construction.
Still kind of works, since it'll roll off of anything not level that you set it on...
flavor: "I would hate to see the house built using one of these things." -- Narius

consumables.name: Liquid Courage
descriptions: A shot of this stuff will carry you into battle! Too bad there's only one shot.
Alcohol is a perfect substitute for bravery, if you have enough of it.
Don't confuse the lightheadedness of the booze with battle fury.
flavor: "How convenient. I was just thinking that this dungeon is driving me to drink." -- Kirak

consumables.name: Potion of Gain Advantage
descriptions: Isn't this for a mechanic from the next edition?
This is a potion from the future! Actually, I don't think this exists in the next edition either.
Someone thoughtfully backported a mechanic from the next edition.
flavor: "Is this really the best the future has to offer?" -- Uharo

consumables.name: Grade A Steak
descriptions: Loaded with enough protein to guarantee musculature.
The dinner (and breakfast and lunch) of muscleman adventurers everywhere.
Hopefully this didn't come from a beast with poisonous or acidic flesh.
flavor: "This more like it! Vikari tired of trail mix.." -- Vikari

consumables.name: Scroll of Icy Glare
descriptions: Harnesses a power previously wielded only by housewives and drill sergeants.
Stop them cold in their tracks with the power of disapproval!
The sheer weight of your glare will critically stun family members and subordinates especially.
flavor: "This scroll is only a fraction as powerful as a master of the art... thankfully." -- Solo

consumables.name: Spoiled Potion
descriptions: The best before date is from ten years ago. Drinking is unadvised; try throwing it instead.
'Store in a cool, dry place' the label says, but this dungeon is humid and musty.
This potion has a layer of scum on the top and floating black bits... you're better off throwing it.
flavor: "I think I've found less disgusting substances stuck in the sinks at the warmage college." -- Laurie

consumables.name: Potion of Magic Energy
descriptions: How does a glass bottle hold a miniature tempest of arcane energy? Don't ask.
Are you supposed to drink it or throw it? Better nominate someone disposable to test it.
Casters turn spells into magic energy. This is full of magic energy. Seems straightforward enough.
flavor: "It might vaporize what we throw it at, or it might collapse the entire dungeon. Let's find out." -- Eleri

consumables.name: Holy(-ish) Water
descriptions: All the real priests were busy that day, so the initiate got to make the water.
A lack of quality control has resulted in an unordained cleric making holy water to mediocre effect.
The Clerics of Bavora outsourced their holy water production to nations with cheap labor, and this is the result.
flavor: "Perhaps I should keep this for when I give You Get What You Pay For sermons." -- Neville

consumables.name: Scroll of Hymn
descriptions: Someone accidentally wrote a song sheet using magical scribing tools, so it turns to dust once sung.
Though a powerful verse, it's hard to remember the specifics, and the scroll annoyingly crumbles after use.
This flagrant abuse of spell parchment and magic ink should at least be used to what little effect it creates.
flavor: "If anyone in my order wasted valuable materials in this fashion, I'd turn their skin into parchment to replace it." -- The Formless

consumables.name: Communion Whiskey
descriptions: Some churches aren't very picky about the alcohol they use.
This probably was intended for a dwarven communion ceremony.
Communion Whiskey ensures that a priest's followers have a strong alcohol tolerance.
flavor: "Is this why none of my acolytes ever want to hold morning services?" -- Erdan

consumables.name: Nerfed Potion of Invisibility
descriptions: Lasts for two rounds? Wow, it's almost useless now.
It used to be these potions lasted five minutes, now it's about ten seconds.
Older adventurers tell tales over tankards of ale about how these used to actually be useful.
flavor: "I used to have a bag full of these, too, before they went and cast the Ritual of Rebalancing..." -- Tal'akh

consumables.name: Scroll of Quiet, Please
descriptions: It's not quite as good as Silence but it's good enough when you just need some peace.
These are most commonly found in libraries that can't afford Scrolls of Silence.
Schools, libraries, daycares and courthouses burn through hundreds of these every day.
flavor: "This would be much more useful if I didn't have to read it out loud." -- Tavila

consumables.name: Bag of Sand
descriptions: Scatter it in front of you. It's marginally quieter than walking on the bare floor.
The soft crunch of underfoot sand is quieter than the echoing noise tiles make, so...
Throw sand onto rough ground, step on sand to be quieter. Flour would probably be a better choice.
flavor: "I hope I have enough sand left to whack whoever I sneak up on." -- Mac

consumables.name: Scroll of Create Magical Toolset
descriptions: Unfortunately it shows up under three layers of packaging and disappears after two minutes.
Disappears after a short while, a matter complicated by the many layers of packaging.
Perfectly serviceable, if you can get it out of the packaging before its duration expires.
flavor: "Whoever made this thing is an insufferable tease." -- Narius

consumables.name: Potion of Open Lock
descriptions: Wasn't this skill removed two editions ago?
Is Open Lock even still a thing? Will this boost Disable Device instead?
Still good enough to drink despite being two editions old, but not good enough to be terribly helpful.
flavor: "Careful there, the last person who drank one of these started ranting about 'THACO's." -- Karth

consumables.name: Demonstration Wand of Detect Traps
descriptions: Trial version. Contains 1 casting of Detect Traps. To order the full version, contact your local arcane supplier.
Hi there! This wand was made by a local artificer. Please support me by ordering the full version of this wand.
If you enjoyed this wand, please consider buying a full one to send some gold pieces my way. Thanks!
flavor: "An interesting business idea, but the Magic Mouth reminder every five minutes is terrible customer service." -- Uharo

consumables.name: Watered-Down Healing Potion
descriptions: It's almost homeopathic.
Is there even any potion left in this thing or is it just water?
It's so diluted you can practically see through the phial it's in.
flavor: "I don't this will cure particularly much other than thirst." -- Eleri

consumables.name: Potion of Painkillers
descriptions: Now, to find some real first aid...
It'll hold you for a while, but it's only treating the symptoms.
Temporary health still counts as health, right?
flavor: "I take these now and again to deal with migraines, not stab wounds." -- Marty

consumables.name: Shotglass of Medicine
descriptions: This wound be great if there was more of it.
It'd be better if you had the bottle this was poured from.
Potent, sure, but where's the rest of it?
flavor: "Am I expected to toassst before I drink thisss?" -- Mardak

consumables.name: Crushed Herbal Remedy
descriptions: These are SUPPOSED to be eaten whole. Oh well, they still work... a bit.
Made from delicate herbs, crushing them has all but ruined them.
Is this what a failed Herbalism check looks like?
flavor: "Not all herbal medicine involves a mortar and pestle!" -- Asira

consumables.name: Scroll of Cure Wound
descriptions: A printing error makes what should be a Scroll of Cure Wounds less useful.
Someone forgot the last 's' on the name and now it's not quite so helpful.
A practical reminder to double-check your spelling when scribing scrolls.
flavor: "I thought people had to be literate to scribe scrolls." -- Ralford

boss.name: The Air Elemental
descriptions: A swirling, vaguely humanoid shape guarding the portal to the Plane of Air. It'll be a breeze compared to later opponents.
A man-shaped collection of gaseous vapors, guarding the Air Portal. Don't get blown away by its strength.
Swirling vapors and gases have gathered to take the shape of a person. It's the weakest elemental, but don't let overconfidence cloud your focus.
flavor: "If you think an air elemental is harmless, just wait until one blows you off a cliff." -- Mac

texts: Burn away the gases with fire!
Freeze it with a cone of cold!
Smother it with a cloud of acid!
Ward the party against its power!
Banish it back to the elemental planes!
Find a weak point and stab it!
Stand firmly so it can't push you, then strike!

events.name: Arrow Trap
descriptions: One of the classics. No dungeon would be complete without one.
Concealed hole in wall fires arrow when triggered. A timeless classic.
You don't have a REAL dungeon until you've installed some of these.
flavor: "Just once I'd like to see a crossbow trap or even a throwing axe trap, just for variety." -- Talon

texts: Knock the arrow out of the air.

events.name: Quarterstaff Trap
descriptions: It used to be a spear trap, but the spearhead broke off long ago.
Lack of maintenance has turned what used to be a spear trap into this.
The spearhead broke off some time ago, leaving just the shaft of wood.
flavor: "This kind of shoddy upkeep would never happen under MY watch!" -- Erdan

events.name: Pit Trap
descriptions: A staple of low-cost traps everywhere, the humble pit trap requires only a shovel and poor lighting to set up.
Needing just a shovel and bad lighting, a pit trap is an excellent choice for an architect on a budget.
Most of the material of a pit trap is elbow grease; even goblins have creation of this trap figured out.
flavor: "AAAAAH-! Oof! ...hey, I found a pit trap!" -- Narius

texts: Fall down, then climb back up.
Jump if you can, get thrown across if you can't.
Strong folks, carry the noodly folks when you jump over.

events.name: Rune of Wound
descriptions: Whoever inscribed this rune wasn't terribly imaginative, but it get the job done.
Does this get canceled out by the Scroll of Cure Wound?
A simple rune made by a simple mind, but it still does what it promises.
flavor: "It could be worse. It could have had an adjective, like grisly wound or festering wound." -- Eleri

events.name: Rune of... something.
descriptions: Trying to figure out what this scrawled rune is supposed to be makes your brain hurt!
What IS this rune? The longer I stare at it the more of a headache you get!
It's like one of those magic eye puzzles but inscribed onto the surface of a doorway.
flavor: "Okay, I've narrowed it down to only 4,672 remaining possibilities... I think." -- Marty

texts: Minor ward from everything, just in case.
What's the worst that can happen?
Ow, so that's what it does.

events.name: Rune of Itching
descriptions: No matter how much you scratch, the itch just doesn't go away!
It feels like someone's rubbing burlap and denim against your skin!
You feel like you have sand in all of your crevices, even ones you didn't know existed!
flavor: "Stop whining! Some of us are wearing plate mail, try scratching yourself through that!" -- Talrath

texts: Undo the rune, if you can focus long enough...
If you can't stop scratching then don't stop running!

events.name: Demonic Crystal
descriptions: It's playing some kind of demonic chant backwards, and it hurts your ears to listen.
Whatever noise this crystal is making, you can't hear it, but you can FEEL it on your eardrums.
This crystal is making a noise that sounds like a cross between nail-on-chalkboard and fifty crying babies.
flavor: "It's still not as bad as the 'music' those inner-city bards are making." -- Bradley

texts: Clean the blood from your ears and keep moving.
Ward the party against the crystal's effects.

events.name: Blood Rune of Advertisements
descriptions: Covers your vision and blots out your hearing with demonic pop-ups, causing you to blunder into other traps.
This rune obscures your vision with pop-up ads for pre-approved soul sales, making you stumble into more traps.
No matter how fast you dismiss the pop-ups, more still come, leaving you defenceless to other traps.
flavor: "No! I don't want any! Get outta here! Any of you clerics got a spell for 'dis?" -- Wyatt

texts: Get out of range, no matter the cost.
Just stumble forward until you get out of range.
Cast the Lesser Ad Blocker spell.

events.name: Floor Zombie
descriptions: This is why you're not supposed to walk on the cracks between floor tiles.
Some zombie fell into a trap door pit, and now takes swipes at passersby.
This trap door has been made more hazardous by the unintentional addition of a zombie.
flavor: "Makes me glad I wore my knee-length hunting boots today." -- Ralford

texts: Rebuke the zombie so it leaves you alone.
Turn Undead so it won't be a problem.

events.name: Stone Block Trap
descriptions: These things are the real reason people wear spiked helmets.
A less than friendly reminder to wear a helmet when dungeoneering.
Given the state of the dungeon, it may just be a collapsing section of the ceiling.
flavor: "Careful... don't step over there unless you have a burning desire to be flatter." -- Lyndra

texts: I've taken worse wounds in tavern brawls.

events.name: Low Budget Caltrops
descriptions: Four-sided dice have been scattered on the floor, and are surprisingly painful to step on.
Plastic building blocks from a children's toy set are scattered here, and hurt to step on.
Numerous glass shards are covering the ground here. Mind your feet!
flavor: "Did anyone happen to see a broom earlier in the dungeon?" -- Tal'akh

texts: Find a path through the caltrops.
Scout a way through the caltrops.

events.name: Tripwire Hallway
descriptions: The tripwires aren't connected to anything, but that doesn't make the tripping any more pleasant.
Landing on your face is pretty embarrassing, so watch your step.
Careful, the floor here is rough concrete just to make your fall all the worse.
flavor: "Wha- ow! ...careful, I found a trip wire." -- Narius

texts: Locate and mark all the tripwires.
Just walk forward, it can't be that bad.
A little trip never hurt anyone.

events.name: Obvious Pressure Plate
descriptions: It wouldn't be that threatening if it didn't take up the entire corridor.
It's easy to see, but unfortunately it takes up the whole floor.
The fact that you can easily spot it doesn't help, given that it takes up the entire floor.
flavor: "Maybe this was cheaper than tiling the whole corridor?" -- Marty

texts: Whatever it does can't be -that- bad.

events.name: Rusted Axe Trap
descriptions: Could really use some oil; it doesn't swing as fast as it used to.
This thing hasn't been oiled in a long time, which is probably to your benefit.
The rust makes the trap swing slower, but it also might cause tetanus.
flavor: "Now see, this is exactly why high quality traps use mithril on the joints." -- Davey

events.name: Swinging Steak Knife
descriptions: Whoever set this trap must have been low on parts and in a hurry.
Some dungeon architects build traps from scrap and junk to keep costs down.
A+ for creative use of parts, D- for effectiveness.
flavor: "What next, a swinging shiv trap?" -- Tal'akh

events.name: Jammed Door
descriptions: Why don't dungeon builders account for humidity when installing wooden doors?
The humidity of the dungeon has caused this door to refuse to open.
Humidity and wooden doors do not mix very well, especially in ancient dungeons.
flavor: "Stand aside. Vikari have something to unstick door: Vikari's foot." -- Vikari

events.name: Rusted Lever
descriptions: A fine lesson on why not to use untreated iron when constructing your dungeon.
Humid dungeons and ungalvanized metal are a disaster waiting to happen.
It's got so much rust on it, there may not even be any iron left.
flavor: "This is worse than that Rust Monster infestation I cleared back in '47." -- Ralford

events.name: Cave-in
descriptions: Some previous overzealous adventurer knocked down a load-bearing column.
At least this didn't happen while you were in the room.
An example of why you should be careful swinging a greathammer near support pillars.
flavor: "Don't look at me, Disintegrate will only remove one rock at a time." -- Eleri

texts: Shove the rubble out of the way.

events.name: Rune of Shiny
descriptions: You can't help but stare at it for minutes on end...
It's so pretty! You just want to stop and look at it for a while.
A shiny thing, the guaranteed bait for adventurers of all kinds.
flavor: "So shiny... must steal... can we pull that brick out of the wall...?" -- Kirak

texts: Stare at it for a while.
So shiny! Admire it for a bit.

events.name: Arcane Puzzle Lock
descriptions: It's pretty straightforward, but the instructions are in an ancient language.
Not a difficult puzzle but the instructions are written in runes for some reason.
This puzzle would be easier if the directions weren't written with magical runes.
flavor: "It might say 'push' or it might say 'pull'. My Ancient Dalvarian is a bit rusty." -- Tavila

events.name: Blinking Rune
descriptions: That rune is blinking! It's so distracting; find a way to make it stop!
Simple things amuse simple... hey! That rune is blinking!
Not only is this rune blinking, it's making an annoying buzzing sound.
flavor: "Why did I agree to come in here with such easily distracted fools, again?" -- Siebel

texts: Find a way to make it stop!

events.name: Break Room
descriptions: Even seasoned adventurers find it hard to resist the smell of a fresh pot of coffee.
Fortunately, no monsters are in here, so you have it all to yourself. Coffee break time!
A cup of coffee and a few pastries will ensure the success of this adventure.
flavor: "We'd better get in 'dere quick before Vikari eats all the food." -- Wyatt

texts: A little break won't hurt, right?

events.name: Insurance Salesimp
descriptions: That's a nice wagon you have outside... it'd be a real shame if something happened to it.
Adventurers like you really ought to take the time to sign a life insurance policy.
You wouldn't want to be inconvenienced if your wagon outside were to burst into flame, would you?
flavor: "Damn fiend! Take your protection rackets back to hell, and put me on the Do-Not-Contract list!" -- Neville

texts: Tell it no until it goes away.

events.name: Nairkholexaqliag'nallfh'picus
descriptions: This minor demon's only notable feature is that it blocks your way until someone pronounces its name correctly.
This unpronounceable demon's sinister plot involves a force field that can only be dispelled by speaking its name.
To get past this annoying demon, you 'just' have to speak its name without any mispronunciations.
flavor: "Oh, sure, let me just DISLOCATE MY TONGUE so I can get this thing out of the way." -- Hodge

texts: Narco... nairko.. nearkho... this will take a while.

events.name: Miniature Labyrinth
descriptions: The architect was going to make it a lot bigger, but they went over-budget.
It would have been more elaborate if the architect had had more time.
Fortunately for you, the builder ran out of money and cut it down in size.
flavor: "I'm fairly sure I could find my way through this blindfolded." -- Ralford

events.name: Pressure Plate Maze
descriptions: The plates aren't wired to anything, but they sound like nails on a chalkboard so you need to avoid them anyway.
Stepping on one does nothing except make a scraping noise that hurts your ears.
You need to avoid the plates, not for traps, but because they make an agonizing nails-on-chalkboard sound.
flavor: "You think you have it bad? Some of us have keen elven senses." -- Aria

texts: Find a way around the plates.
Find a path through the plates.
Determine what tiles are plates and avoid them.

events.name: Glue Sprayer Trap
descriptions: Typical, you just washed your equipment earlier today, too.
Ugh, and you washed all your gear earlier...
Great, now you're stuck to the floor AND it's oozing under your armor.
flavor: "'Don't prepare Prestidigitation,' you guys told me. 'It's all monsters and traps,' you said..." -- Marty

texts: Scrape off the glue and keep going.
Tear yourself free of the glue.

events.name: Obvious Secret Door
descriptions: There's ALWAYS a secret door in a dead-end like this, it's just a matter of finding it.
A dead-end corridor? There MUST be a secret door here!
No dungeon can have a corridor ending in nothing. There's obviously a secret door.
flavor: "Trust me, pal, dungeon construction regulations require secret doors in all dead-ends." -- Rick

texts: Poke every brick and pull every torch.
Press every brick in the wall until you find the right one.

events.name: Gear Puzzle
descriptions: Pile of gears on the floor. Exposed incomplete machinery in a wall access panel. What comes next is obvious.
An open panel to some machinery is next to a bunch of gears on the floor. Seems obvious what to do next.
A bunch of gears have been removed from a door control mechanism. Better put them back in and hope none are missing.
flavor: "Child's play. Quite literally. I believe I have seen toys based on this premise." -- Avaris

texts: Try gears at random until it works.
Shove gears in until it works.

events.name: Trapped Locked Door
descriptions: Unfortunately, if you kick this one, it explodes; best to just pick the lock.
Breaking down the door makes it explode, so picking the lock is recommended.
Someone expected you to kick the door open instead of lockpicking it; it'll explode if you try that.
flavor: "Step back, meatheads, this one is going to require some finesse, not smashy-smashy." -- Kirak

texts: Disarm the trap and open the door.

monsters.name: Sizzling Lizard
descriptions: This lizard glows bright red because it's hot enough to melt iron, so don't attack it with anything you're particularly attached to.
A type of salamander hot enough to melt iron. Ranged attacks are recommended.
Unlike other lizards, this one generates its own heat, so much so that it sets things on fire by touching them.
flavor: "I strongly recommend our unarmed fighters leave this one to the archers." -- Ralford

texts: Some ice spells will sort this out.
Blast it with a wave of frost.

monsters.name: Unconvincing Mimic
descriptions: The shading on it is too bright compared to its surroundings.
It's using the wrong color palette for this section of the dungeon.
It's not aligned on the same five-foot boundary all other dungeon objects are.
flavor: "There's something wrong about this chest... okay, everything is wrong about this chest." -- Asira

texts: Give it a whack before it strikes.

monsters.name: Minor Demon
descriptions: This demon is so low on the infernal ladder that it doesn't even have a name or description.
It's so minor that it doesn't have a name or any sort of description.
A demon so boring nobody has bothered to name or describe it.
flavor: "I have no idea what it is - I only study IMPORTANT demons." -- Mulcahy

texts: Hardly worth it, but banish it anyway.

monsters.name: Crazed Dwarf
descriptions: "Come, fight me!" he shouts, "Losing is fun!"
This dwarven warrior charges you on sight with a cry of "Losing is fun!"
A dwarf driven mad by the dungeon, he has taken the battle cry of "Losing is fun!"
flavor: "I once heard of an entire fortress of my kin falling victim to a madness much like this." -- Volkur

texts: Beat the rocks out of him.

monsters.name: Goblin Scavenger
descriptions: An economically and ecologically friendly goblin, she recycles the equipment of dead adventurers by selling it off to new ones.
This goblin does her part for the environment by recycling the equipment of dead adventurers, selling it to new ones.
Adventurers on a budget can buy secondhand equipment from goblins like these who loot the bodies of other adventurers.
flavor: "I don't want a dead guy's gear. It obviously didn't do him any good." -- Hodge

texts: Knock her out while she's distracted by something shiny.
Beat her up and take her stuff.

monsters.name: Rebellious Elven Youth
descriptions: "I'm 107, why don't my parents listen to me? I should be allowed to dye my hair and wear eye shadow..."
You can overhear complaints about his parents' curfew and bedtime rules despite him being 107 years old.
From what you overhear, this 107-year-old ran into this dungeon because his parents didn't approve of his girlfriend.
flavor: "I bet he'sss ssstill living in his parentsss' houssse, too." -- Mardak

monsters.name: Swarm of Cats
descriptions: This dungeon used to have swarms of rats, but then this happened.
Once, there were swarms of rats in this area. Now, there's this.
This is why you'll never encounter any rats in this dungeon.
flavor: "Good luck herding them." -- Ralford

texts: Set a trap and lure them into it.
This is what sweep attacks are for.

monsters.name: Kobold Trapper
descriptions: It's actually a friendly monster, but spike traps and swinging blades are traditional kobold greetings.
Spike traps! Swinging blades! They'd be more threatening if they weren't small-sized.
The gauntlet of spike traps and swinging blades were this monster's welcome mat.
flavor: "Oh, no, the traps are solely for when other races come to our homes. We don't like visitors." -- Kirak

monsters.name: Alchemical Mishap
descriptions: It's hard to tell what's worse; this thing, or that the dungeon floor is withstanding its caustic substances.
The dungeon floor is somehow sustaining this thing; what the hell is it tiled with?
Despite the acidic fluids this thing is oozing, the floor is undamaged. Is it adamantium, or asbestos?
flavor: "Ugh, I think I had to clean one of these out of the sink last week." -- Dresbin

texts: Lightning Bolt it before it gets close.
Protection from Acid. And Protection from Alkali for good measure.

monsters.name: Obscure Undead Subtype
descriptions: Based off a mash-up of three different cultures' mythology, with a weakness taken from a fourth.
It's like someone threw a bunch of mythological undead in a blender and wrote stats for the result.
This homebrewed monstrosity is a mash of four other undead types from different sourcebooks.
flavor: "I've never seen one of these, but I know all the things it was cribbed off of." -- Mulcahy

monsters.name: Boarse
descriptions: Boar + Horse. Wizards will try to crossbreed anything these days.
A Boar/Horse combo? Wizards will crossbreed anything.
Half-Boar, Half-Horse, all stupid. Wizards will try to crossbreed anything.
flavor: "I hope for the sake of the local ecology this is the only one of its kind." -- Asira

texts: Blast it with a wave of fire.

monsters.name: Minmaxed Spellcaster
descriptions: He has a combination of three different classes and a huge EXP penalty, but man, look at that will save.
He has enough flaws to singlehandedly keep a psychiatrist employed, but check out his spell damage.
Cherrypicking three different classes, he'll never cast high-level spells, but his defences are fantastic.
flavor: "That is a dark road, darker than any magic. Beware, for in that way lies only madness." -- Siebel

texts: His AC and Perception are awful. Sneak up and shank him.
His Reflex save sucks. Orb of Electricity.
His Fortitude is bad. Poison Cloud.

monsters.name: Creeper Vine
descriptions: The room is covered in its tendrils, and they like to grab you when you go past.
This overgrown plant seems harmless until it tries to wrap its vines around your legs.
With vines and tendrils covering the room, anyone who thinks it's just a dumb plant will get grabbed.
flavor: "My brother once told me about a fight with a tentacle monster... but I think it was just one of these." -- Solo

monsters.name: Failed Golem
descriptions: Someone didn't follow the assembly instructions, and now there's an arm in the head socket.
The result of a failed Craft check, this golem has three legs somehow.
An untrained attempt to assemble a golem has resulted in one with its head on backwards.
flavor: "Even in the earliest days of my apprenticeship I never managed such a spectacular failure." -- Avaris

monsters.name: Newbie Necromancer
descriptions: They've been popping up everywhere since "Necromancy for Dummies" got published.
Someone held a seminar on getting started with necromancy recently, and now everyone's giving it a try.
Thanks to a local necromancer's conference, everyone with black robes and access to corpses is trying it.
flavor: "If only my sermons got this sort of result. Maybe if I provided snacks..." -- Neville

monsters.name: Dark Recruit
descriptions: The Forces of Evil have surged in membership ever since they started hosting job fairs.
A recent recruitment drive by the Forces of Evil has provided plenty of new members.
Seems that those recruiting posters for the Forces of Evil have done their job.
flavor: "People are only signing up because the Forces of Evil offer healthcare benefits." -- The Formless

monsters.name: Personal Space Invaders
descriptions: Ugly little gremlins, they like to get far, far too close to people.
These hideous little gremlins enjoy giving awkward handshakes and hugs that last too long.
Not only do these repulsive gremlins enjoy giving unpleasant handshakes, their hands are permanently clammy.
flavor: "I can't stand these things, it's almost as bad as dealing with city merchants." -- Uharo

texts: Set a trap and lure them into it.

monsters.name: Taped-up Skeleton
descriptions: You'd think there would be no shortage of intact skeletons to use for materials in this dungeon.
Are there really so few intact skeletons in this dungeon that they have to be taped together?
Some newbie necromancer here must have been desperate for materials.
flavor: "Maybe if we leave it alone long enough it'll just fall apart on its own." -- Wyatt

texts: Set off a trap when it's in the way.

monsters.name: Dwarven Robot Bees
descriptions: Who would make these?!
Who made these?!
Who thought this was a good idea?!
flavor: "Whyyyyyyyyyyyy?!" -- Marty

texts: Sneak and pray to all the gods they don't notice.
Smoke the bees to disable their tracking.
Not the bees! Not the bees!

monsters.name: Trainee Ninja
descriptions: Someone should have told her not to wear white socks with her sandals.
They'd be better hidden if they'd taken off the bright red bandana.
Unfortunately someone slipped bleach in their laundry so their once-black robes are kind of a faded gray.
flavor: "If a ninja fails to hide, are they really a ninja?" -- Lyndra

texts: Set off the trap he's hiding next to.

equipment.name: Shortsword
descriptions: No adventuring party is complete without possessing one of these at some point.
You're not a real adventurer until you've had at least one of these in the party.
You have to have one of these in the party at some point to be a REAL adventurer.
flavor: "It slashes AND stabs. What more could dungeon crawlers like you want?" -- Uharo

equipment.name: Shortspear
descriptions: When spears are too long and daggers too short for your stabbing needs, the shortspear has your back.
Want to wield a polearm but don't want to use two hands to do it? Here's the solution!
If you want both a shield and a polearm, the shortspear is the way to go.
flavor: "What this? Some kind of toothpick?" -- Vikari

equipment.name: Shortbow
descriptions: To be fair, it might be a regular bow for small-sized creatures.
It could also be a longbow for tiny creatures.
If you've ever found yourself needing to fire a bow under a low ceiling, this is what you needed.
flavor: "Even a small arrow can bring down a giant, provided you hit something important." -- Ralford

equipment.name: Shortaxe
descriptions: All the limb-hacking power of an axe without the cumbersome swinging arc.
Whoever said axes are slow and unwieldy weapons hasn't tried one of these.
Just in case you needed to chop up some shortlogs for your shortfireplace.
flavor: "Fortunately, I don't belong to one of those orders that says knights must only use swords." -- Talrath

equipment.name: Basic Wand
descriptions: One inch shy of a foot, holly wood, phoenix feathers for a core. Suitable for an adolescent wizard at best.
It's a regular old stick with some magic inside of it. It'll work, but no points for style.
Just a smooth varnished stick of wood. Be careful not to get this mixed up with a drumstick.
flavor: "Maybe with some silver caps and gold engraving, it could be a real wand..." -- Laurie

equipment.name: Arcana Textbook
descriptions: Jam-packed with magical theory that no wizard ever uses in practice.
It costs two hundred gold pieces new and is required reading at wizarding college.
Required reading at the mage's college, and surely by coincidence, written by the Evocations professor.
flavor: "Sadly, they are only worth twenty percent of their original value second-hand, even in mint condition." -- Uharo

equipment.name: Wizard Academy Robes
descriptions: Stitched with the academy's emblem, and a handful of protective - and tracking - enchantments.
The fibers of this fabric serve as a tracking device, preventing young wizards from causing mischief.
These robes both track students and protect them from whatever they encounter during ill-fated adventures.
flavor: "I feel like if I put these on, my old teachers will appear and yell at me for breaking curfew..." -- Marty

equipment.name: Sorceror's Necklace
descriptions: It has a bit of the previous owner's power stored inside, and some of their blood on the outside.
Some less-fortunate mage left this behind. You can borrow their power, just mind their bloodstains.
Although it still holds some arcane power left to be tapped, it's soaked in the blood of its previous owner.
flavor: "A bloodstained trophy just isn't the same when you didn't spill that blood yourself." -- Hodge

equipment.name: Iron Holy Symbol
descriptions: Iron is a perfectly pure and sacred metal among some dwarven clans.
Iron is a popular choice of holy metals among religions on a budget.
Perhaps not as good as a steel or silver holy symbol for some groups, but it works just fine.
flavor: "I prefer something practical to a gaudy display of gold and jewels. ...no, really." -- Erdan

equipment.name: Holy Book (1st Edition)
descriptions: Aside from the "Thou Shalt Commit Adultery" typographical error, a perfectly serviceable text.
Some of the names are mistranslated, but otherwise it'll do fine.
It's flawless, but for the plotholes in the creation myth that got fixed in later editions.
flavor: "Should one ever attain godhood, be sure to get a proofreader on the edicts to your followers." -- Neville

equipment.name: Giant Ankh
descriptions: It's intended for religious purposes, but could be used as a bludgeoning weapon if you really had to.
Filled with nondescript holy power, it can be swung two-handed for some ordinary skull-cracking power.
Smite evil. Bonk monsters on the head. This comically oversized ankh does it all.
flavor: "Depending on the religion it's for, using it as a melee weapon may or may not be heresy." -- Mulcahy

equipment.name: Mitre
descriptions: This hat is used to make you look bigger, and thus, more intimidating.
This oversized hat makes you taller, which in turn makes you more imposing to your enemies.
Donning this clerical hat will make you so tall that those around you will be awestruck.
flavor: "It's just like how animals try to look big to scare foes, except you're doing it to demons." -- Ralford

equipment.name: Cushioned Boots
descriptions: They offer terrible traction but nobody will ever hear you approach if you can stay upright.
Although it's a challenge to walk in them, they silence your footsteps wonderfully.
It's not unlike wearing eight pairs of socks. If you can avoid falling over you'll walk silently.
flavor: "Oh man, if we find a polished wood floor, this'll be great." -- Wyatt

equipment.name: Camouflage Cloak
descriptions: The pattern of this cloak looks exactly like the rough stone walls the dungeon is made of.
This cloak has been enchanted to match the rough stone walls in its appearance.
Although it only covers your torso, it'll make that much of you look just like the wall behind you.
flavor: "Plus, if you curl up underneath it, you can disguise yourself as a rock." -- Karth

equipment.name: Kunai
descriptions: You can throw them to distract someone. They can also open boxes and tins.
Throw them at distant walls to distract enemies. Also works as a letter-opener.
A ninja tool that can be thrown to make a distraction. It's also useful prying stuck doors.
flavor: "Hand that here, I have some trail rations stuck in my teeth I need to pick out." -- Tal'akh

equipment.name: Hand Mirror
descriptions: Lets you peek around corners surreptitiously. Can also help ensure that if you are spotted, you look fabulous.
You can use it to peek around corners. It also lets you cheat on light-beam puzzles... if only this dungeon had some.
Use it to look around corners, send signals, fix your hair, and prove to people you're not a vampire.
flavor: "Don't give that to Tal'akh. His face will make it shatter." -- Hodge

equipment.name: Lockpick Set
descriptions: Standard-issue thieves' tools that are somehow legal for sale in equipment shops across the kingdom.
Every rogue makes sure to legally buy a set of tools designed for illegal purposes.
For whatever reason, these can be legally purchased in any equipment shop in Cordan. Don't question it.
flavor: "Oh yeah, the Thieves' Guild makes these. It's a great way to get more recruits." -- Kirak

equipment.name: Dwarven Army Knife
descriptions: Almost all the tools are for opening alcohol containers, but there's a screwdriver and pliers too.
It has fifteen different ways to get into alcohol containers, along with some more common tools.
Seven bottle openers, three wine corkers, and even a tool for tapping beer kegs. Plus some other stuff.
flavor: "This is far better than the human ones. Really, who needs a letter-opener on the battlefield?" -- Erdan

equipment.name: Alchemical Rust Remover
descriptions: Rust is a serious problem in dark, damp dungeons that get left untouched for decades at a time.
Rust is the bane of dungeon architects, given that dungeons tend to be damp and unmaintained for decades.
You'll be all set if you run into a rusted lever, rusted door, or a rust monster infestation.
flavor: "I will hold it. This stuff does not mix well with open flames, and you mages love your fireballs." -- Avaris

equipment.name: Crowbar
descriptions: Why did you head out on an adventure without one, anyway?
What kind of adventurer are you if you didn't have one of these in the first place?
Now you're properly equipped to sneak around a dangerous place full of monsters.
flavor: "I have an inexplicable urge to start smashing crates and boxes now..." -- Rick

consumables.name: Potion of Strength
descriptions: An adventurer classic, often sold to illiterate fighters who won't know about the side-effects of steroids.
It's basically a shot of fast-acting steroids. The effects are temporary, the side-effects are permanent.
One dose won't hurt, but career adventurers should be careful about long-term abuse of strength potions.
flavor: "I'm pretty sure drinking this would violate the monk's code for keeping a pure body." -- Mac

consumables.name: Potion of Extra Muscle
descriptions: Enlarge your biceps instantly! Results guaranteed, or your money back! (Effects not permanent)
Guaranteed to enlarge biceps, triceps, quadceps, pentceps, hexceps, and more, just not permanently.
So effective, even your muscles will have muscles. Fortunately, the effects are temporary.
flavor: "Drinking this isn't going to make me forget how to read, will it?" -- Dresbin

consumables.name: Herbs of Rage
descriptions: Do not confuse with potpourri, garnishes, or tea leaves.
It is highly recommended not to use these for cooking.
These herbs, when chewed, grant a brief combat fury. When smoked, they cause fistfights.
flavor: "These are dangerous if wild animals get into them... you heard about the killer rabbits?" -- Asira

consumables.name: Potion of Fireball
descriptions: A spicy drink that makes you cough up a fireball shortly thereafter. Or, you know, you could just throw it.
Drink swiftly, then cough up a fireball. Or, for the sane adventurer, throw it at what you want to blow up.
Drink this to do a dragon impression and breathe fire! Or throw it, and keep your throat un-burned.
flavor: "Pah, I've drunk worse. If you think this is bad for your insides, try a mug of Orcish Moonshine." -- Karth

consumables.name: Dead Wand of Lightning Bolt
descriptions: You can probably squeeze one more charge out of it if you destroy the wand in the process.
It'll destroy the wand if you wrench out its final charge, but what else would you use it for?
Sadly, since you have no way to recharge it, you might as well force a final casting and destroy the wand.
flavor: "I strongly recommend not using this while wearing metal gauntlets, or you'll find the experience shocking." -- Avaris

consumables.name: Scroll of Drain Life
descriptions: The drained life goes to some unknown place, not you, but it'll still damage your target.
Unfortunately the drained energy goes off to some malevolent force somewhere, but it still deals damage.
Doesn't heal you, since the drained life is given to some elder god, but your target will still get hurt.
flavor: "It's only one little scroll of life draining. I doubt we'll cause the end of the world with it. Probably." -- Tavila

consumables.name: Holy Water
descriptions: Comes in an extra fragile flask for throwing at things that hate divine energy and/or glass shards.
Throw it to deal radiant damage to certain creatures, and slashing damage from the glass shards to anything.
If you throw it on the floor it'll burn with a holy fire for a few seconds. That's how water works, right?
flavor: "Most churches are on a budget, so the ability to weaponize water is a powerful one." -- Neville

consumables.name: Divine Fortune Cookie
descriptions: It contains a miniature Scroll of Holy Word, and the cookie is an excellent snack.
The cookie is a fine snack, and inside it is a tiny Scroll of Divine Fortune.
One side of the fortune is a line of scripture, but the other side is a Scroll of Holy Word.
flavor: "These are hard to make! Have you ever tried writing scripture on something so small?" -- Mulcahy

consumables.name: Holy Acid
descriptions: Nothing in the rules says you can't make a multiclass Cleric/Alchemist.
Alchemists who enter the clergy are responsible for these things.
For extra style, set it on fire to deal three different damage types at once.
flavor: "Apparently, anything can be made Holy if a cleric is the one who crafts it..." -- Lyndra

consumables.name: Potion of Levitation
descriptions: Make sure you have walls to push off of, or you're going to need to throw things behind you to move around.
Floating above the floor means no footsteps. It also means that Physics says you need to push off walls.
Levitation sounds great until you realize you can't walk; make sure to stay in arm's reach of the walls.
flavor: "It's one of those things that's a lot better in theory than in practice." -- Aria

consumables.name: Scroll of Blink
descriptions: Instead of a short-range teleport, this scroll makes things blink when looking near you, giving you time to hide.
Causes nearby creatures to blink uncontrollably, preventing them from spotting you.
Anything in your vicinity will be forced to blink its eyes repeatedly, letting you pass undetected.
flavor: "These are handy to have if you have a bit of sand or something in your eyes." -- Talon

consumables.name: Anti-Lantern
descriptions: Used by light-sensitive creatures in bright areas to cast a shadow around you. Explodes if it touches a lantern.
Removes light from the nearby area to create darkness. Because that makes perfect sense.
Sucks light out of the user's vicinity. Great for sneaking, raves, and campfire storytime.
flavor: "What do you mean, useless? Maybe your species should have evolved darkvision." -- Tal'akh

consumables.name: Interchangeable Antimatter Key
descriptions: You found a small key! It can only be used in this dungeon to open a locked door. Which door? Any door!
Opens any door by destroying both itself and the locking mechanism.
You got a small key! Use it to open a locked door... permanently.
flavor: "With any luck, the Water Elemental won't require us to find a big one of these." -- Lyndra

consumables.name: Breaching Charge
descriptions: Mages aren't the only ones who can solve problems with explosions, you know.
Trapped doors explode; untrapped doors can be exploded.
For when you want to say, 'Screw this door in particular'.
flavor: "This here will make short work of even the rustiest of hinges." -- Davey

consumables.name: Scroll of Reveal Traps
descriptions: Highlights mechanical traps, magical traps, and crossdressers within a radius of the user.
Casts a magical glow around trapped doors, trapped floors, and crossdressers nearby.
This scroll reveals all nearby traps, including crossdressing passersby.
flavor: "The problem is, most people don't try and use one until they've already stumbled into a trap." -- Marty

consumables.name: Generic Healing Potion
descriptions: Who makes these? What's in them? Nobody knows, but adventurers swear by them anyway.
Every supply shop is stocked with these things, but nobody knows where they come from.
Enough of these can heal any injury, yet their ingredients are a complete mystery.
flavor: "Don't look at me, I just sell them. For a tidy profit, I might add." -- Uharo

consumables.name: Healing Herbs
descriptions: Closes a wound when rubbed on it. Also makes for an excellent cup of tea if steeped.
Apply to a wound to heal it rapidly. Or, chew them for instantaneous fresh breath.
Rubbing this on a wound will heal it. Not recommended to use for seasoning meat.
flavor: "These herbs have many medical uses... but everyone always tries to eat them." -- Asira

consumables.name: Enchanted Bandages
descriptions: These bandages automatically stop being adhesive when the wound is closed, and don't have to be ripped off.
Herbal cures quickly mend wounds under them, and magic removes the adhesive so they don't need to be torn off.
Designed for species with fur, these bandages lose their adhesive and fall off when the wound is healed.
flavor: "It's easy to say 'Man up and tear it off' when you won't lose a layer of scales in the process." -- Tal'akh

consumables.name: Scroll of Healing
descriptions: Ironically, these scrolls are notorious for causing papercuts if mishandled.
Though effective, these scrolls are known to cause papercuts very often.
The precise craftsmanship of these scrolls often leads to papercuts, minimizing their effectiveness.
flavor: "Okay, who's wearing chainmail gauntlets and knows how to use these?" -- Siebel

consumables.name: Blood Clotting Medicine
descriptions: Apply externally. It is highly recommended not to drink this.
Apply to wounds directly; do not drink it. Keep out of reach of children and orcs.
Used to stop wounds from bleeding. Drinking it is ill-advised.
flavor: "It's also handy for getting blood off of your clothing as long as it's still wet." -- Aria

boss.name: The Water Elemental
descriptions: A transparent humanoid figure formed from water. Don't underestimate it, or you'll get washed away.
This guardian of the Water Portal is a column of water in the shape of a man. You'll have to pool your resources for this fight.
The embodiment of water taking a humanoid appearance. As long as you're careful, you'll control the tide of the battle.
flavor: "There's water all over the floor. Great. I bet the room under this is soaked and covered in mold." -- Narius

texts: Boil away the water with fire!
Freeze it with a blast of cold!
Banish it back to the elemental planes!
Break its attacks on your shield!
It bleeds water; slice it open!

events.name: Crossfire Trap
descriptions: If one arrow trap is good, multiple arrow traps is even better.
Arrow traps: Why stop at just one?
Whoever built this must have gotten a bulk order discount on arrow traps.
flavor: "And they laughed when I tried to learn how to dual-wield tower shields." -- Talrath

events.name: Ceiling Spear Trap
descriptions: Because dungeon adventurers always forget to look up.
Because everyone is so afraid of floor traps, they never look up.
A sudden and pointed reminder to look up, too.
flavor: "See, dat's just karma for all those short jokes." -- Wyatt

texts: Break it when it comes out.

events.name: Statue Trap
descriptions: Attempting to search this statue for traps will make it take a swing at you.
The statue has a real sword because it swings at you as you go past.
A statue of an armed warrior that clobbers adventurers who pass by it.
flavor: "Some prankster set this up. I'd know, we've got fifty of them at the temple." -- Erdan

events.name: Rune of Fire
descriptions: Setting things on fire: The cause of, and solution to, arcane problems everywhere.
Triggered trap causes sudden gouts of fire. An arcane classic.
A blast of fire assails your party. A requirement for all dungeons over level 1.
flavor: "Good scribing. Proper triggering. Potent infusion. Solid B+." -- Marty

events.name: Rune of Ice
descriptions: Intended for air conditioning, the mage who made it was from the Great Northern Wildlands, and he likes it cold.
Perfect for making ice cubes, preserving meat, and freezing adventurers in their tracks.
This rune sends a chill blast of icy wind over your party, which wouldn't be so bad in in the summer.
flavor: "Look, YOU might be from some frozen wasteland, but some of us would prefer not to become icicles." -- Hodge

texts: Bundle up and take the hit.

events.name: Rune of Electricity
descriptions: This nefarious rune is invisible to the naked eye - but it buzzes audibly when you approach.
Although you can't see this rune, you can hear a loud electrical buzz when you get close.
This rune buzzes with the electrical energy it wants to discharge into you, which is good because you can't see it.
flavor: "That sound? Oh, it's just 3,000 volts waiting to zap you. Standard dungeon fare." -- Eleri

events.name: Life Drain Crystal
descriptions: These are used by both Evil Cults and by Medical Professionals to collect large quantities of life force for transfer.
Evil Cults use these all the time for their rituals; Medical Professionals use them to heal life drain effects.
These terrifying crystals drain the life of those nearby for later transfer. A common tool of Evil Cults and Medical Professionals.
flavor: "No, I will not go first. Contrary to popular belief, I do, in fact, have a soul." -- The Formless

events.name: Miniature Hell Portal
descriptions: It's only the size of a fist - and a demonic fist will swipe at you as you go past.
This fist-sized portal seems innocuous, until a demonic fist smashes you when you walk by.
About the size of a fist, this rift in the planes allows demons to punch passing adventurers.
flavor: "Lazy demons use these. Saves them having to actually come to the material plane." -- Mulcahy

texts: Send some divine energy through the portal.

events.name: Eldritch Tentacle
descriptions: If this is just one appendage, it would suck to fight the rest of the Thing it's attached to.
It could be worse, you could be fighting the rest of the Thing this tentacle belongs to.
An unpleasant fight, but at least you're not fighting the owner of the tentacle.
flavor: "If you cut off a piece, give it to me. Eldritch Calamari is a valuable delicacy." -- Uharo

texts: Dispel the portal the tentacle is coming from.
Purify the tentacle to back where it came from.

events.name: Spring-Loaded Pressure Plate
descriptions: Launches you into the ceiling at high speed. Multiple times, if you fall back down onto it.
The strongly-wound spring will launch even the fighter in plate mail into the ceiling.
The only hint to this pressure plate's existence is the cracks in the ceiling it will launch you into.
flavor: "These aren't so bad in a dungeon with higher ceilings." -- Kirak

texts: Locate and go around the trap.
Find the plate and go around it.
Search for the trap and get past.
Send someone with a helmet in front.

events.name: Concealed Pit Trap
descriptions: Any pit trap can be improved with a flimsy cover. In this case, it's paper-thin floor tiles that shatter when stepped on.
Also known as the Level 2 Pit Trap, upgraded with a flimsy cover designed to look like the floor tiles around it.
Are your pit traps too easily avoided? With a pit trap cover (only 250 gold pieces!) you can catch 75% more adventurers, guaranteed!
flavor: "What th- whaaaaaagh! ...hey, I found a covered pit trap!" -- Narius

texts: Find the pit the hard way.

events.name: Mithril Caltrops
descriptions: The only reason to make caltrops of mithril is to show adventurers that they're dealing with a high-class villain.
Finding these in a dungeon is how you know you're not dealing with a run-of-the-mill antagonist.
Only the classiest of dungeon lords sees fit to outfit his lair with caltrops of this stature.
flavor: "If we weren't in such a hurry, I'd totally steal and resell these. Or melt them down." -- Talon

texts: Pick a path through the caltrops.
Find a way around the caltrops.
Find a way through the caltrops.
Suck it up and walk across.

events.name: Bear Trap
descriptions: Don't forget that this is a fantasy setting, so it also works on owlbears, chimeras, and wildshaped druids.
This formidable trap is a staple of dungeons the world over and is the bane of bears and bearshaped druids alike.
Spring-loaded steel jaws designed to immobilize large creates, like bears, small dragons, and shapeshifted druids.
flavor: "Hold it! Unless you were looking to get a peg leg, stay away from there..." -- Lyndra

texts: You're wearing greaves, it'll be fine, right?

events.name: Mechanical Spike Trap
descriptions: They extend, they retract, they extend, they retract. And then they alter the timing after a while just to mess you up.
These spikes extend and retract on a pattern. And just when you think you have the pattern figured out, it changes.
Although these spikes extend and retract on a pattern, it changes as soon as you think you've got it down.
flavor: "Hey, I filed a patent on a trap like this! Some no-good thief is stealing my designs!" -- Davey

events.name: Dwarven Crossbow Turret
descriptions: The dwarves never figured out friend/foe recognition, so it just shoots anything that moves.
A handy turret that only has the flaw of being unable to identify friendlies, thus shooting at everything.
Although a marvel of dwarven engineering, it shoots at anyone and everyone nearby, enemy or not. A major flaw, that.
flavor: "Ugh, these things. Do you have any idea how hard it is to make the sales pitch for them?" -- Uharo

texts: It only has a finite amount of ammo, right?

events.name: Pushable Block Puzzle
descriptions: At least whoever built this had the decency to include a reset button.
A staple of dungeons everywhere, made more tolerable with a built-in reset button.
Build your muscles and brains with this classic dungeon element. Now with a reset button included!
flavor: "Vikari is bored. When can Vikari get back to crushing tiny men's skulls against wall?" -- Vikari

events.name: Portcullis
descriptions: The mechanism is broken, so someone will have to muscle up and lift it.
The chain to raise it is broken, so you'll have to just lift the thing manually.
Unfortunately the mechanism is busted, so you'll have to force it open.
flavor: "Who uses a portcullis indoors anyway? Doors are better; you can kick 'em in for a dynamic entry!" -- Rick

texts: Pool together and stuggle to lift it up.
Give up and find another path.

events.name: Over-Barricaded Door
descriptions: There's practically two doors' worth of wood here.
Someone has used enough boards and nails on this door to make a small shack.
Somewhere, underneath layers of boards nailed around the frame, is a door.
flavor: "I really hope this isn't keeping some horrible monster trapped on the other side." -- Dresbin

texts: Break through the boards and the door.

events.name: Rune of Fun
descriptions: The ultimate delaying tactic, since time flies when you're having fun.
An insidious rune that makes you oblivious to the passing of time through distraction.
Not only will you waste precious time, you'll enjoy doing it, too!
flavor: "No, we can't stay 'just a bit longer'! We have a country to save!" -- Laurie

texts: Count with a Rune of No Fun.

events.name: Teleportation Trap
descriptions: Hope you really liked those last few rooms, because you'll be seeing them again real soon.
If you missed anything in the last few rooms, you'll get a chance to check them again in a moment.
Set off this trap and you'll be getting an instant replay of the last few rooms you went through.
flavor: "What's worse, the architecture of this place all looks the same, so it's hard to know if you triggered the trap." -- Marty

texts: Just set it off and run back.
Set it off, then quickly return here.
Use a stasis field to counter the trap.

events.name: Slow Motion Rune
descriptions: Everything is going to be very dramatic for a little bit if you set this off.
Slows down you and everything you in your vicinity, and distorts sound so everything is baritone.
Gives you an extended period of Arrow Time to either pull off epic dodges, or embarrass yourself terribly.
flavor: "On the plus side, it'll increase your reaction times for a while. ...technically." -- Tavila

events.name: Riddle Demon
descriptions: Solve his puzzle and win a prize! The prize is getting to keep all of your blood.
Answer the riddle correctly and your internal organs will remain internal.
This ungodly powerful demon enjoys puzzles. Answer one and he won't vaporize you where you stand.
flavor: "This will be easy. The thieves' guild loves giving these kinds of puzzles during interviews." -- Kirak

texts: Double- and triple-check to make sure it's the right answer.
Ask the gods for the answer.
Petition your patron deity for the answer.
Ask a knowledgable deity for the answer.

events.name: Lonely Ghost
descriptions: It has a tragic story of how it came to haunt this dungeon, and just wants you to stay and listen to it.
It's going to force you to sit there and listen to its sob story of why it's in this dungeon.
It sealed the doors and extinguished most of the lights so that you have to listen to its tragic backstory.
flavor: "Why does every deceased spirit feel the need to tell its life story?" -- Lyndra

texts: Listen, since you don't have a choice.
Make the ghost feel better so it lets you go.

events.name: Idle Zombie Champion
descriptions: Its master was killed, so it's just standing here. Unfortunately, it's right in your way, and it's wearing fullplate.
This giant armored zombie is completely motionless, since its master was killed. However, it's blocking the doorway.
A massive zombie in fullplate blocks the door. Its master is dead, so it won't move at all, which means it's still a problem.
flavor: "This is why I always program my golems with a default location to ransack. Incidentally, it is my rival's estate." -- Avaris

texts: Rebuke it so it runs away.
Smite it so it moves away.

events.name: Circular Labyrinth
descriptions: Every single passage is curved, which serve only to make it all the more disorientating.
Every last passage curves and makes this maze more confusing than a linear equivalent.
All the walls are curved, which makes this labyrinth more of a pain than usual.
flavor: "Even when you're not lossst, you ssstill end up walking in circlesss!" -- Mardak

texts: Keep trying passages until you get through.
Map it and find the right path.

events.name: Trick Staircase
descriptions: Transforms itself into a slide if you stand on the wrong steps. Wheeeeeeee!
One foot on the wrong step, and you're going to slide all the way back down to the bottom.
Some stairs are trapped to turn the whole staircase into a slide, so step carefully.
flavor: "Sure, it sounds fun, right up until you land on the guy in spiked armor." -- Talon

texts: Guess that was the wrong staaaaaaaair!
Find the path up the stairs.
Locate and avoid the trapped steps.

events.name: Tar Trap
descriptions: It'll dump a bucket of feathers on you afterwards, just to add insult to injury.
Not only is it really disgusting, it takes FOREVER to get off of your gear.
Comes with a complimentary feather trap that shares the same trigger.
flavor: "You think you have it tough? Imagine trying to get tar out of the joints of plate armor." -- Talrath

texts: Ick, it's all over my clothes!
Get it off, get it off!

events.name: Suspiciously Panelled Corridor
descriptions: One of these uniformly sized and spaced wall panels must be a secret door, but which is it?
The fact that this corridor is lined with a series of identical wall panels means one MUST be a secret door.
The only possible reason there are wall panels here instead of rough stone is that one of them is a secret door.
flavor: "If it turns out that these are all actual wall panels, I am going to kill the dungeon architect." -- Eleri

texts: Pull every panel until one moves.
Quickly find and open the secret door.

events.name: Balancing Scale Puzzle
descriptions: One of the more difficult ones, these weights have fractional values and come in two different measuring systems.
This tricky puzzle has weights of mixed measuring systems, so here's hoping you can do conversions.
Annoyingly enough this puzzle's gimmick has weights of fractional values and multiple measurement systems.
flavor: "How many 2nd Century Pounds are in a 10 Century Kiloaum, again...?" -- Asira

texts: Keep trying stuff until it's solved.
'Adjust' the scale to the correct value.

events.name: Circuitboard Puzzle
descriptions: Hope you remember how logic gates work, or you'll be at this for a while.
Yes, it is a bit of an anachronism, but since when did that ever get in the way of a good puzzle?
Binary logic has been around forever, allowing formal logic and obtuse puzzles to be created.
flavor: "What the hell is an XNAND supposed to be? Are we sure this uses binary logic?" -- Solo

texts: Keep trying stuff until it works.

monsters.name: Red Dragon Hatchling
descriptions: It's sleeping on a small pile of treasure, and is curled around a goblin skull.
It only has a small pile of treasure, and a couple goblin skeletons nearby.
Less fearsome than a full dragon, it still has a small pile of loot and some goblin bones to chew on.
flavor: "No, Vikari, you can't keep it as a pet. It would burn the house down." -- Eleri

texts: Knock it out of the room.

monsters.name: Mimic Chest
descriptions: It would have had you fooled if it hadn't given a rumble of hunger when you got close.
It almost tricked you, but then you noticed the drool coming from the keyhole.
You were almost taken in by it, until you noticed the blood around the lid.
flavor: "Why do people keep making chests that look like these things?" -- Kirak

monsters.name: Insurance Salesimp
descriptions: That's a nice wagon you have outside... be a shame if something were to happen to it.
About that wagon you have outside the dungeon... be a real shame if it broke, wouldn't it?
Remember that wagon you left outside the dungeon? You want to protect it, right?
flavor: "Ugh. No, I don't want to hear 'bout the package deal on lodgers' insurance!" -- Wyatt

texts: I've got a better deal for you: my fist.
Knock the imp into next week.
Smash the imp as a form of refusal.

monsters.name: Grinding Adventurer
descriptions: Driven mad and frothing at the mouth, he rants out how all creatures contain "experience points" that they release on death.
This mad adventurer rants about the "experience points" inside all creatures, then looks at you hungrily...
Crazed in his search for the "experience points" all creatures release on death, he charges at you with rage in his eyes.
flavor: "Experience Points? Pah! Who ever heard of such a thing? This man is insane." -- Mulcahy

texts: Kill him and take his EXP for yourself.

monsters.name: Orc Butcher
descriptions: Prime Adventurer Rib goes for a lot these days!
He knows all the cuts to make to turn you into a prime selection of meats.
His cleaver strikes are precise; he doesn't want to damage the goods, after all.
flavor: "You don't want to eat me, I'll be all tough and stringy. You can try the others though." -- Tal'akh

texts: Block his cleaver and smash him.
Parry the cleaver, then stab him.
Chop him up before he chops you up.

monsters.name: Half-Fey Lizardfolk
descriptions: What racial ability combination possessed someone to come up with this?!
Someone must have wanted to min-max really hard to come up with THIS.
This is why parents shouldn't min-max their children.
flavor: "What da hell! Why is dis a thing? Dis has to be illegal." -- Wyatt

texts: Get into the shadows and snipe it.
Drag it into the shadows and shank it.

monsters.name: Giant Scorpion
descriptions: It could be worse, it could be a giant spider.
At least it's not a giant wasp or something.
As giant insects go, there are much more terrifying options.
flavor: "Giant scorpion meat is a delicacy in some parts of Cordan. No, really, stop looking at me like that." -- Ralford

texts: Find a trap to make it walk into.
Trick it into setting off a trap.
Smash it between its chitin plates.
Flip it over and strike its underbelly.
Wait for an opening and stab its face.

monsters.name: Kobold Rivals
descriptions: They keep trying to outdo one another with their traps; now you need to get past them.
A friendly rivalry has resulted in a corridor filled with mechanical traps of every nature.
Apparently engaged in a trap-waving contest, these two have filled a whole corridor with the things.
flavor: "It's like keeping up with the Joneses, except instead of a new horse, it's mechanical death." -- Kirak

texts: Beat up the kobolds and make them disarm the traps.
Smack the kobolds; get them to disarm the traps.
Beat on the kobolds until they disarm the traps for you.

monsters.name: Slime Janitor
descriptions: Although not technically employed as a janitor, its hunger for all things on the floor does the same job.
It's not paid, but it still picks up and dissolves junk and bodies on the dungeon floor.
It slurps along and dissolves bodies and trash on the floor, so it's been named an honorary janitor.
flavor: "These things are pretty handy... until they decide to eat your shoes." -- Marty

texts: Zap it with a Lightning Bolt.
Lightning Bolt until it stops moving.
Send an Orb of Electricity at it.

monsters.name: Nonstandard Vampire
descriptions: Quick, consult the third-party sourcebook to find out how these vampires work!
Better dig into the third-party sourcebooks to find out how this one works.
This isn't a homebrew one, is it? Better interrogate the dungeon master and make knowledge checks.
flavor: "There are laws about this, you know! Vulnerability to garlic and sunlight is legally mandated!" -- Neville

texts: Sonic damage? Maybe it's weak to that?
Smite it with nondescript holy energy.

monsters.name: Wolphin
descriptions: Wolf + Dolphin? Some wizard must have made this crossbreed on a bet.
Combines the predatory instincts of a wolf with... a dolphin's playfulness? I don't know!
A wolf-dolphin cross that mostly serves to make those nearby it question their perception of reality.
flavor: "I don't... who would... what does... why is this a thing?" -- Ralford

texts: Take it by surprise and stab it.
Immolate it with assorted fire spells.

monsters.name: Crypt Looter
descriptions: They used to be called "Tomb Raiders" until some guild copyrighted the name.
At least, that's what they've been called ever since some guild copyrighted "Tomb Raider".
Or "Tomb Raider" if you don't mind violating the namesake guild's copyright.
flavor: "It's a tough job. Any dead person with stuff worth stealing probably trapped the lot of it." -- Kirak

texts: Distract him with something shiny and stab him.
Shank him while he's looking at something shiny.
Use a shiny thing to get his attention, then backstab him.
Knock him off a platform with a blast of wind.
Fireball him back where he came from..

monsters.name: Vandal Dryad
descriptions: This forest spirit is only here to ruin the dungeon's structural integrity by growing weeds, moss, and mushrooms everywhere.
A forest spirit who has taken it upon themselves to grow moss, weeds, and mushrooms everywhere, ruining the dungeon.
This is the reason for the weeds cracking the floor tiles, mushrooms rotting the wood, and the moss creeping across the walls.
flavor: "I can understand their plight, but... the Anarchy symbol moss pattern seems a bit excessive..." -- Asira

texts: I love the smell of Burning Hands in the morning.
Fire Storm the area back to the way it was.
Find a fire trap and lure the dryad into it.
Trick her into breaking a volatile trap.

monsters.name: Clockwork Golem
descriptions: Unfortunately for you, it's ben wound up recently and will keep ticking for quite some time.
Theoretically you could wait it out, but it learned to wind itself a while back.
This golem has been wound recently, so don't try waiting for it to stop on its own.
flavor: "Clockwork's too unreliable to use any more. Steam's the way of the future, son!" -- Davey

texts: Corrosive Bolt to the clockwork heart.
Jam something into an important gear.

monsters.name: Overzealous Necromancer
descriptions: He sent his minions off to other parts of the dungeon and forgot to keep any to protect himself.
This necromancer sent all of his minions off to other dungeon sections, leaving himself defenceless.
Normally a necromancer is a difficult foe, but this one sent all his minions off on errands and left himself alone.
flavor: "Aw, man, I was hoping for a more dramatic fi- I mean, great, something easy! Let's go!" -- Rick

texts: Since he's alone, just ambush him.
Smite the necromancer with radiant fire.
Consecrate the area to negate his magic.

monsters.name: Evil Recruiter
descriptions: The Forces of Evil's healthcare plan is to raise you as an undead of your choice if you happen to fall in battle.
The Forces of Evil have a great retirement plan, knowing full well few of their members will survive long enough to use it.
Join the Forces of Evil and receive on-the-job training for looting, kidnapping, and other transferrable skills.
flavor: "It sounds good on the surface, until you have to meet a quota of Evil Deeds every month." -- The Formless

texts: Backstab before he can start trying to recruit you.
Smite with the power of Good.
Summon some animals to distract him.

monsters.name: Hungry Troll
descriptions: Yes, it's redundant to call a troll hungry. It's like calling a dwarf short or an elf snobby. Either way, it wants to eat you.
We're aware that 'Hungry Troll' is as redundant as 'Grumpy Orc' or 'Wisecracking Halfling'. It still wants to eat you.
Trolls being hungry is like gnolls making silly noises or gnomes wearing stupid hats; they're always like that.
flavor: "Remember the three rules about trolls: 'dey regenerate, 'dey hate fire, and 'dey always win drinking contests." -- Wyatt

texts: Trick it into setting off a trap.
Make it chase you into a trap.
Hold Monster and beat it up.
Summon a chicken to distract it.

monsters.name: Fast Zombie
descriptions: Hey, they're not supposed to be this fast!
Zombies aren't meant to be fast! That's cheating!
An affront to traditional zombie lore everywhere.
flavor: "Take heart; it would be a lot more dangerous if it were part of a horde." -- Talrath

texts: Set a trap for it to run into.
Set off a trap near it.
Turn Undead so it goes slower.

monsters.name: Dwarven Robot Bats
descriptions: The only thing worse than Goddamn Bats is Goddamn Bats Wtih Armor Plating.
Because regular bats weren't bad enough, apparently, now they have armor.
You know how annoying bats are in dungeons? Imagine that, but now they have armor plating.
flavor: "These things have been known to drive off invaders by annoying them into submission." -- Volkur

texts: Locate and disable the control mechanism.
Find a way to disable them.

monsters.name: Goth Adventurers
descriptions: It turns out that dressing in black and wearing dark makeup is pretty decent dungeon camouflage.
Black leather is not only a decently protective light armor, it blends in well in a dark dungeon.
Evidently, black leather, makeup, and hair dye is a good combination with poorly-lit dungeons.
flavor: "If only they didn't have such pale complexions, they'd be undetectable." -- Aria

texts: Sneak up on them and strike first.
Get the drop on them from behind.
Wait for them to pass and ambush them.
Set a trap - that hair dye is flammable.
Set off a trap near them.

equipment.name: Flaming Longsword
descriptions: Comes with an asbestos sheath to stop your pants from catching fire when you're not using it.
Also comes with an asbestos sheath so that it doesn't set your pants on fire.
As a bonus, it comes in an asbestos sheath, so you don't need to wear fireproof pants.
flavor: "These things are great for killing hydras, fighting trolls, and cutting potatoes." -- Karth

equipment.name: Animated Shield
